FgVAgcmHtO3c52NdPedqbw.text: Wally`s is my number one go to place in Phoenix to eat and bring people to when they are visiting. I go to Phoenix a few times a month and I frequently find myself eating here.  Their Gruyere and slab bacon s` mac is to die for. Probably my favorite Mac and cheese ever. And I eat a lot of Mac and cheese. Super good atmosphere for a date and they have great service. They were awesome to us last night and they were busy.  It was Valentine's and we still got timely and great service. Love Wallys!

NkGYZv0limBXDzyfvi5pzw.text: Thank god for the delicious food, because the poor service I've received from Shannon on numerous occasions for take-out would have deterred me from coming back a long time ago.

N4sRtOtu-Zfero7Ib1Zqig.text: I was in for lunch today with a party of 5 people ... Wally came over to the table to say Hello And to ask everyone if they were having a good day ... He thanked us for coming in. Our waiter was very attentive and on top of all of our needs. Mat stopped by the table as well ... He was Very appreciative that we stopped in,  considering it was one of the hottest days ... Mat is One of the nicest people that I have met in a long time ...  I am a new customer,  and intend on returning as much as possible. The food is outstanding and the prices are fare ... Sometimes, it blows my mind with the negative reviews ... If you can't say anything  Nice,  don't say anything at all   Happy to sign  Dawn P

xt0pqsbLK-Nr1NixEFo0kA.text: YUM! Mac N Cheese Skillets...the cheeseburger one is like Hamburger Helper LOL, so yummy. The side of sauteed spinach was yumalish too. My business partner got the chicken brie sandwich which looked great too and the mix of sweet potato, regular fries and onion rings is a great idea, unique. I saw MANY things that I would eat here when cheating :) Definitely not a healthy food place although they did have salads and veggie burgers. Very loud inside, UK beers on draft, nice outdoor patio.

7ubceYkDDAiYlDvOP90IuQ.text: YUM!  We live 45 minutes away from here and still have to come at least 1-2 times a month.  Good prices, fresh food, great tastes!  The blue plate specials are awesome.   Prime Rib is always on point!

Zbt9Hlfu2zevs4eOoKZsKQ.text: The first time that I went into this place I thought that it was okay. I did not feel like it lived up to the rave reviews but it was good enough to bring me back to enjoy some food and drink with an old friend.  That time I had ordered their shrimp cocktail while I waited for my friend to arrive, I was starving! As I was eating, the owner (I assume) came up to introduce himself and asked if I live in the area (most of the patrons do)...as I turned back towards the bar to eat my very last jumbo shrimp, the Katie Perry look alike grabbed my food and dumped it in the trash! She never even asked if I was finished. I asked her if she decided that I was done eating and then she asked if I wanted another shrimp from the kitchen but I felt awkward at that point and told her no. She still brought me one lonely shrimp on a huge plate with no cocktail sauce. The sauce is what makes the shrimp cocktail. My friend and I then ordered their spinach dip.  The dip was brought out and as the plate was lowered to the bar, my chips were sliding off onto the bar and she just scooped them back on to the plate. I personally was not thrilled about that. I scooped some spinach up on to my dirty chip, blew on it a little and took a bite. This dip was the hottest (heat wise) thing that I have ever had in my mouth. I would compare it to biting the rack in a broiler.  I was never warned that they heat their dip up so hot. I guarantee the work of a microwave! I burned myself so bad that my mouth was peeling and bleeding. It took over a week of peroxide rinses, colloidal silver rinses and salt water rinses to heal my mouth. My mouth is actually scarred inside! This burned me so terribly that my teeth were sore, my jaw hurt and even my sinuses on that side of my mouth hurt. When I stopped in to tell the brunette bartender about my burn and I advised that they should warn people about how hot they make it, she replied with "Well, don't scarf your food down, let it cool first." Totally rude, offensive and bad customer service with a reply like that. That same night that I burned my mouth, my friend was using their hot sauce to spice up her chip and the bartender came over and started twisting the lid back on without asking if she was done and my friend had to stop her from taking it away. She clearly has issues with letting people finish their meal. When it came to the bill she had to ask us how many drinks we had because she wasn't keeping track... It seriously was not a lot of drinks to keep track of either. I think this place would be OK if it wasn't for this bartender. I did order a salad on a separate occasion (when I warned her about the hot dip) and that proved to be disappointing as well, way too much dressing and she kept giving me a hard time for not drinking during my work hour. Booooooo!!!

YgrcL1clMcgN_SITbonMHQ.text: An Irish pub on St. Paddy's day must be done!  I came here on Paddy's day for a few beers and lunch.  This is a place I could see myself frequenting once a week.  It has a down to earth vibe to it even though its in Arcadia.  I had the Shepherds pie for lunch.  I wasn't a fan of it, but it wasn't god awful.  I've definitely had better.  I just wish you could smoke on the patio!

AwMZoyqUg4ES80FiiQB_OA.text: My first time here for lunch. I went with 2 other friends.   What we had: Appetizer: artichoke and spinach dip with tortilla chips  Lunch: fish and chips, and their special of the day meatballs.  We got our appetizer and it was good. The fish and chips were a little on the greasy side, but what do you expect for fried fish and french fries. The meatballs... that's another story. They used a spice in it that had a very strong licorice taste (I think the spice is called anise). There were 4 meatballs for $7.95. I took a small bite off of one and almost gagged. I could not handle the licorice taste. I asked if I can substitute it for fish and chips and make it "to go" as we were running out of time. When the check came, they did not take the meatballs off and asked the waitress about it. Come to find out that the OWNER said "JUST BECAUSE I DIDN'T LIKE IT, I STILL HAD TO PAY FOR IT!". I WAS SHOCKED!!!!  I told her, then I didn't want the fish and chips. I only ordered a higher price item as not to walk out with only a $30 bill.    We ended up leaving paying $46, $8.00 for the meatballs that I only had 1 bite out of! It's a good thing I ate my share of the artichoke dip or I would have STARVED!  I WILL NEVER BE COMING BACK HERE AGAIN!!!!!

uhsdV6n342PC8J0WIXkp2Q.text: Wally's is an upscale pub with a price tag to match but the menu is carefully thought out, well prepared and (usually) served with a smile.

aGFHsCwCn_JiPAS0qdyjyQ.text: I travel frequently for work and look for local, good restaurants to try as opposed to the big chain places.  I found this joint on Yelp and it looked good and was close to my hotel so I gave it a try.  I sat at the bar and was promptly greeted by Trish the friendly bartender.  She was vibrant and working hard, but took time to ask where I was from and to explain the menu with suggestions.  I decided on a cold beer while I mulled it over.  Then a guy walks in and sits down right beside me and starts chatting away.  He seemed like a regular here and a pretty cool guy.  I talked a little with him and asked him for his menu suggestions and come to find out, this guy was the "Wally" that owned the place. What a great character this guy was.  Anyhow, after another beer or two, I took their suggestion and ordered the day's Blue-Plate Special which was a Fried Chicken dinner for Monday's.  I was skeptical of ordering fried chicken when I was looking for something exciting, but based on the recommendations, I gave it a try. It was superb, crispy boneless breasts served with a salad, mashed potatoes, and a white-chocolate bread pudding desert.  All so tasty.  A little more chat with Wally and I found out he's a frequent traveler to Key West, FL (Another of my favorite places).  He goes down there every year for the Hemingway Days festival where he's a past winner of the Ernest Hemingway look-alike contest.  I will say, they didn't miss with this guy.

5Qd6aG3wzJMk0FGdpTWk8Q.text: I would describe Wally's as "comfort food." The crowd here is a good, healthy mix and the restaurant is kind of hidden in the Camelback Corridor area.   The pluses: - A great happy hour from 4-6  - Occasionally, you'll get a stellar sale on wine (A co-worker and I got a dry Riesling on sale for $12!) - Cozy patio - Consistent service - "Hole in the wall" feeling to the place  The negatives: - "Comfort food" isn't usually healthy food - A little pricey for what you get...  If you're in the area, it's definitely a great place to try.  But I wouldn't go out of your way to try it!

lN_mlnNrkhYe6IjsZCPxvw.text: Wally's is one of our favorite places to eat lunch and dinner. It has a neighborhood feel to it, and the food is consistently delish! The owner, Wally, and his son's run the 2 restaurants and treat everyone that walks in the door like an old friend--which I love.  Their grilled artichokes are to die for, and the pot roast is a must, especially on cold days. The Danish ribs are the best that I've had in the Valley--they fall off the bone and have a devine flavor. Friday lunch special is fish tacos and they are absolutely wonderful! I can go on and on, but you must try this wonderful place yourself!

bN3bLSXoAMNzQcQqBx6puw.text: So after an exhausting day the man and I decided we wanted to be waited on for dinner.  However we couldn't come up with a style of food we were hungry for.  Now, when this happens my boyfriend invariably reverts to his inexplicable love for TGI Fridays.  I don't really understand the infatuation.  Friday's is fine, I guess, but when there are so many other better options why bother?  Plus there isn't one remotely close to my house.  So i start rattling off other pub-ish type places in the area where he might have a similar (but better) experience.  We settled on Wally's.  I had been once before but this was his first time.  When we walked in, the host gave us our choice of seating and we decided on a high top near the bar.  As we settled into our seats and took a look around, we agreed that the ambiance and decor are homey and welcoming without being obnoxious.  In fact, it sort of looks like a low key Friday's.    Our waiter came by promptly and took drink orders.  Wally's has a decent beer selection and the bf thought they had a nice whiskey selection as well.  We noticed how good the calamari looked as it was delivered to a nearby table and ordered that to start.  As we waited for it to arrive, we concentrated on our figuring out our entree orders.  I ultimately went with the chicken quesadilla off the appetizer menu and the bf ordered the Frisco burger.  The server was accommodating and helpful, making suggestions and answering questions as needed.  He specifically mentioned that the chipotle mayo on the burger was fantastic.  When the calamari arrived, we dug in.  The calamari well well cooked, with crispy breading and tender meat.  The marinara it was served with though was underwhelming.  We sat for a minute wondering whether to send it back or just deal.  Then, my bf said, "I wonder how that chipotle mayo would be with the calamari?"  Genius.  We flagged down server and he agreed that the mayo sauce was great with the calamari.  In fact, it was a  vast improvement.  They should just serve both sauces with the calamari.  Or ditch the marinara altogether.    When our entrees arrived, bf was pleased with the mix of onion rings, fries and sweet potato fries served with the burger.The burger was cooked to order and similar to a patty melt.  My quesadilla, while not Mexican restaurant quality, was decent for the environment.  It was tasty and I appreciated the sides of sour cream, avocado and salsa it came with.    Our server was attentive throughout the meal and checked in on us occasionally.  He offered dessert, but we were too stuffed.  Overall, we had a great experience.  I enjoy Keegan's as a neighborhood pub spot, but I like Wally's better. We'll be back for sure.

mduu61OvVr9ZRu84-AxilA.text: I love the food and atmosphere at Wallys - the Chicken Vesuvius is sooooo good.

wenXZc-KsNTVMXisEVWp5w.text: I heard from a friend about this place. So i decided to give it a try, he so far has not lead me wrong. Once finding a place to park and entering, the manager introduced himself and was pleasant to talked to. A great place that doesn't have the "franchise" tag on it and definately a place where you don't mind coming back.  Having the 'Frisco burger and Hefeweizen, I had no complaints...  the fries were mixed together, regular and sweet potatoe (nice touch). Decent selection of beers on tap, attractive waitresses and great people who you can see enjoy their job. Definately a place I intend of coming back

Z2FpNrsRViFIXD4j7Q4Csw.text: Group of 6 popped in on a busy Friday night at 7:00.... Never been here before. Greeted like we were old friend and we were told a table could be found in a few minutes. We complicated it by asking for a table with a view of the TV for the baseball game viewers in the group. Wow... Seated within 4 minutes and lovely server who knew the menu well took great care of us. Highlights.... Everyone loved what they got... Onion soup, yum-o, s-Mac n cheese... Had the Gruyere and bacon version, wow! Would definitely order again and drive out of our way for it!  Pot roast.... Great atmosphere, reasonable prices, great service and great food.  Yay!

_DBrCmjfFKbogTRT9qli4Q.text: Can years of good service and food be off set by one HORRIBLE evening? Maybe... Went to Wally's with group of 5 people. The food was Wally's standard but the service was really bad. The server was rude, un-accommodating and slow. She forgot things (like a salad) and started invoking "new rules" about taking more than 3 credit cards for a group (even though equally split). She also lectured us on how she would apply the Wally's dicount card. It wasn't so much about the money, it was about the awful way she made us feel. If they want to discontine the discount cards, do it - don't come up with a bunch of arbitrary rules at the last minute... that just ruins things.  Wally's faces new competition in the neighborhood and if they want to stay in business they need to focus on service and keeping their long standing clients happy. The food is never the BEST or  WORST in the valley but the local feel and comfortable service are the big draw. Without that, there is no reason to go there.  Although we've eaten at Wally's at least once per week for more than 5 years, sadly, it will be quite some time before we return. Phoenix resturants compete in a service industry and when service is gone there is little reason to stick around- there are too many other, good options.  I'm giving my review a 2 rating because the food was OK. Based on service, I'd give it a zero! We're looking forward to Steak 44 and The Henry is wonderful. Wally, bye bye for now. Clean up your act and maybe we'll be back... maybe.

JTCA8U2ocxoSHbSaAs8OPw.text: Good solid American food, albiet high prices.   Wally's has never disappointed me when I have been looking for a heavy, high fat, filling meal of American "cuisine." This place is a great spot to visit if you have no regard for your health but high regard for your taste buds. It's leaps and bounds better than your typical pubs, serving good quality food rather than the apropos french fries and chicken fingers. Sure, they will serve you chicken fingers, but I much prefer the Bourbon Street Pasta, a cajun pasta with peppers, cream sauce, sausage, and chicken?  There is an upstairs, downstairs, and a nice patio, and they have a good staff. There is nothing groundbreaking about any aspect of this establishment, but you can always bet it will be a satisfying meal for anyone considering going to a bar for dinner.

cEScexUEvMu1t_252q_hdg.text: Food is spectacular. Best american food in this city hands down. Staff is exceptional, friendly, everyone knows your name. Wally... he's kind of a grouch. But whatever. I think he's just getting old... and tired of it all. The bar is adorable, the patio is so cozy and quaint, and the laughter makes this place a joy to be in. Great place.

B5lPhRsjyvoqbir5ZvQa3A.text: While these stars are not for a healthy meal, they are for a delicious one!! The food here is unbelievable and I find myself craving the dishes I've tried: the tuna sandwich and the veggie burger. My friend had the meatloaf and despite the giant portion, was able to finish it all because it was that good. The service is also great and the ambience was an unexpected surprise. Very cozy and homey with a hint of old world charm. All around, a highly recommended neighborhood establishment!!

BA9MBL5XcF5Q_lAiZ2Ab_w.text: I stopped in on a Saturday around noon. I was planning on getting just one beer. I had the Four Peaks Hop Leaf and it was really good. But wait, they had another. I tried the Four Peaks Kilt Lifter, and it was even better! The keg ran out, and I had a enjoyable front row seat as the staff had a little difficulty replacing the keg. Jokes were made. Maybe some feelings were hurt. Vindication was had shortly later.  I stayed for three beers, originally intending on staying for just one. I really enjoyed the staff (super attentive), the ambience, and the beers. I will definitely come back every chance I have.

WPoY1TYxhUMojkpe6YRe0w.text: This place is amazing! They have the best Irish coffee in Phoenix. They also have a great Artichoke. I don't think we have had anything that hasn't been good here.  The staff has always been friendly and very attentive and always ready to help if you have a question about the menu. It has a great atmosphere and welcoming staff.

ksIemwAFqdDyNZ2LUV8q_g.text: Neighborhood spot with great, homemade food. The french dip was incredible as were the ribs. Looking forward to coming back to try the burgers which looked amazing. Only improvements I'd like to see are more local draft options

FUpyTpKYNzge1VhBBpfuHQ.text: Why have I never been here before?! This cute little spot is hidden off of 44th Street & Camelback. We walked around & into the courtyard where we were greeted with a warm smile from the host. We decided to sit out on their patio to enjoy Phoenix's lovely weather (the inside was just as charming). Our waitress Julie told us the specials and provides excellent service. I ordered the Cuban which was delicious and instead of fries I subbed a fresh fruit cup for $1 more. The cup had pears, apples, strawberries, & blueberries. My co-worker ordered the Pear & Berrie Salad, she loved it. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuban with fresh fruit! Delicious

8Z_8luhpNCWFzQU4NciDDA.text: Wally's is certainly a step above the normal pub food.  Don't let the name fool you.   There is another location in the Gainey Ranch area and the menu is diverse with everything from great salads to meatloaf that won't disappoint.  It's a little pricey, but the quality helps offset the hit to your pocketbook.  Great wine list and creative cocktail menu to boot.

_OB1Oun1Hvu77aDM8k5uyQ.text: Went in early on a Wednesday night, took our 4 year old.  I just didn't feel like cooking, but I was not prepared for Wally's.  I had the Grueryre Mac n Cheese, my wife had the salmon special, and my son had the spaghetti and meatballs kids meal.   Everything we ordered was best of its class.  The S'mac was heavenly, the salmon was a huge, moist, and expertly cooked.  They also had an impressive drink and food menu.  Plus it was laid back, and our server Shawn was top rate.  We'll be back, I cannot believe there isn't a line to get in.

JlAbW2Re66RlKY2Gxln0cA.text: Came here with the family on St. Patrick's Day. As expected, the place was definitely busy but we noticed the entire staff working together to make sure everyone was seated as soon as possible. There was a slight hiccup when someone else answered the call for our table. However, once we figured out what had happened we were seated immediately. The menu was fixed for St. Patrick's Day so we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip for and appetizer; my husband got the shepherd's pie, my daughter had the chicken fingers, and I enjoyed the fish and chips. Everything came out quickly and hot. The food was delicious! We finished off with the bread pudding for dessert...heavenly!!! We will definitely be returning for another visit!

hlWjxyK-YfiuInwuED1-oQ.text: Cute pub and Atmosphere but slow service. My friends and I went in at lunchtime on a Saturday and it took about 30 minutes before our order for appitizers was taken and it took our entrees 20 minutes to come out after our order was placed placed. The restaurant was only a fourth of the way full so I'm not sure what was taking so long. I'll have to give this place another try another day. Maybe today was just not a great day for them.

bF8ovf2dnlYs6EmV0GKGAQ.text: Went here a couple of weeks ago, and was curious to see how the service would be after seeing some of the other recent low reviews.  I have to say that I was very impressed--our server was fantastic, and the manager and another server also stopped by our table to say hello and check on whether our food was enjoyable (which it was!).  Excellent comfort food in a cozy setting, with strong drinks! The only thing I'd like a little more of would be a more extensive mixed drink selection, but based on what they offer, they seem able to accommodate most typical drink requests. I will be back!

EoNRL1POctOXGnwhObU3FA.text: We are out of towners and thanks to the yelp reviews, we decided to come here for lunch on a beautiful April afternoon. Our server was fast and friendly. Ordered the local red ale and it was cold and tasty.  My hubs got the smacs with Gruyere and bacon. He devoured it!  I got the grilled artichokes! Loved them!  The blackened chicken and Brie sandwich with mixed fries. It was delicious and ample. Please try this restaurant and sit outside if it's pretty! We had a memorable experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ry6F9X4OTuOG_OnRBlUokw.text: So we got seated and then got forgotten about.  It took about 15 minutes before someone, the hostess as it turns out noticed and apologized profusely.  We ordered the grilled artichoke appetizer and it was AH-MAZING!! When we received our appetizer and drinks and the gal told us the appetizer was on the house and again appologized for the delay in not getting to us sooner.  I don't have a problem with people making mistakes, we all do... what I care about as a customer is how you handle dealing with the mistske.  The staff was EXEMPLARY, appologized appropriately, made no BS excuses,  offered the free appetizer and extremely attentive service after that.  I ordered the prime rib sandwhich and my wife ordered the fish & chips.  Borh were very good!!  We were both delighted with the food and service.  Pleasantly pleased!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside the bar downstairs

YVa-CQzsSyJvGAV1Sli6ZQ.text: Blue cheese escargot is amazing, pineapple martini was outstanding. Portions are generous, service is friendly and attentive, great location.

9lg6vQGCH3hQsaJWr6xZiA.text: One of my favorite restaurants.  The service is great, they have a great, huge menu, and they are kid friendly.  It's a great place for a business lunch, a date, or to take the kids.  The Frisco burger is amazing.

f2gyaC0yOTXu9qkVQvbiZQ.text: Let me start out by saying this place is way out there, but for sure worth the drive!   Our server was Nico and he was super friendly, knowledgeable and one of the best servers we've had! I ordered the Mac n cheese with bacon and some funky (yet delicious) cheese. My mom got the prime rib dip, and my dad the cheeseburger. All SO good! I'm usually not one for prime rib unless it's in a salad but this was good.   I didn't drink, but my mom enjoyed a few (too many) cosmos. She said they were strong, but not rubbing alcohol strong. Prices were a little higher than most, but once you see how much food you get its not bad at all!   Definitely recommend and make sure you ask for Nico!

ecHy-hVIORv9XQgrRYtEYA.text: Fairly expensive place for what it is. I think it's prob a good place for middle aged ppl to go out and have beer. Not really my style but food and beers were decent.

gPKedLQjGyR6t3zTr4jymw.text: Cute, quaint little pub. There's nothing like a good, stiff drink on a lazy Sunday afternoon!   I tried the calamari for an appetizer. It was served hot. Nothing unusual or different about it. Now the California Cobb salad; (yum) it was gigantic! ...very hearty! Our waitress was on her second day on the job, but one could barely tell it. Well, outside of forgetting little things ...like silverware, parts of the food order, and other small requests... She had a very friendly attitude and she knew the daily specials and MOST of the menu...very impressive for a second day.  Pet-friendly, outdoor seating available.

WEYsAOxt2rzS4dMHVt-qGg.text: out of town and want a guaranteed good gourmand experience this place does not dissapoint. staff is very friendly. I had the wine burger. served on a bakery style bun, it was super moist and the mix of fries, onion rings and sweetpotato fries was awesome. the wife had blacked chickens brie and I tried a tasty, very good. I would regular the place if I lived closer.

1fAcA2d0_vrmcEaJzkEISw.text: Great local pub with an extended selection of bar dishes!  They have amazing mac n cheese with various types offered.  The servers are attentive without being bothersome and also extremely knowledgable.  I have dined here twice now and have had an enjoyable casual dining experience both times.  This is a great place in a wonderful neighborhood to kick back in a casual atmosphere for those days you don't want to get all dolled up to go out for a nice meal :)

I0gA7at0jDEzIoUJ5tYShQ.text: Went for Father's Day and always like the food. Nice family friendly. Very relaxed environment. Love their spicy Louisiana Pasta, their burgers are good too. Girl with black hair and green eyes is alwasys so nice!

tRk_a6Fgm9fSTq3moIa8Jw.text: Great fish and chips! Husband loved his beef stroganoff, too. Would skip on the brownie dessert, didn't think it was that good for $8 and $5 for an extra scoop of ice cream?! But overall great food and we will return!

zhoIb1EZDFDpp42r-0B-ag.text: We found this little gem while surfing the internet for french onion soup in the Phoenix, Az area.  The service was very quick and the soup was great.  I also ordered the four cheese mac n cheese, which came out in a skillet topped with breadcrumbs.  I think it was the creamiest, and definitely cheesiest mac n cheese I've ever had.  Asiago, mozzarella, parmesan and monteray jack cheeses created such a great dish. My husband had the California Cobb salad with chicken.  It was nothing special.   But why come to a pub for a salad?   Overall I was satisfied.

i3xdPs5TIKXVC6kknKkQTg.text: Much better experience this visit. Food was excellent and service exceeded expectations! I had the hummus with carrots and celery and my wife had Matty's Beef Stroganoff and we loved them both! Will definitely return!

TqEdX_rpyUp_eeyi3Quy2Q.text: Really cute upbeat atmosphere  Great food; especially the chicken brie panini  Great attentive service.  If you get garlic toast ask for it crispy or else it may come out doughy inside.

IIGgsWUnY0zPRrJdskW7yQ.text: I found this place as I was parking to go to Flower Child on St. Patty's Day (as you may guess, my St. Patty's Day wasn't very exciting). I feel like I've thoroughly searched through the Arcadia area on Yelp, so I was surprised to find that the place had character and looked super inviting from the outside but yet it'd never come up in any of my searches.   As soon as I got home, I pulled up Wally's on Yelp and made a note to go there ASAP.  Wow! What a hidden gem within "trendy" Arcadia. The inside is quaint, casual, and inviting and outside there's seating on their patio that is adorned with bistro lights.   The staff was very friendly, and the food was excellent! We came in on the tail end of happy hour on a Sunday afternoon. I've attached the HH menu, but overall, some great deals on apps and beer. We went with wings and beer to start (excellent btw), and for dinner, I went with the reuben and my fiance went with the fish and chips (see pics). My reuben was okay but did not come out the traditional sandwich that I was craving..It was filled with ginormous pieces of brisket and was on something that resembled a po' boy bun..not Rye. Somewhat of a let down but not all was lost - I loved the shoestring fries as a side. My fiance loved the fish and chips - no complaints there!  Overall, I really loved this spot and can't wait to try it out again. Arcadia lacks this sort of casual bar/restaurant and though my fiance and I were probably the youngest in there (we sat next to a party of 8 who were 60+), the atmosphere and comfort food menu (i want to try out more items) will definitely bring us back in.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HH menu
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. How quaint!
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Non traditional Reuben

XoCcKAg1gghbRGZBdmARLQ.text: Service was beyond horrible. Food was good, some of it even really good but the service overshadowed it. I reserved a table for 12 for a casual affair, 4 of us arrived early and ordered drinks. He literally brought one drink at a time and this continued all nite even after the rest of the party arrived and started ordering drinks ( not sure if they have trays or he just didn't know to use one). Our food was ordered and, again, our food came out in stages. My friend ordered a burger and another person ordered a salad. Those were the last meals to come out after most of us had gotten ours for at least 10-15 minutes. When we got there, there were about 6 tables with people, not a lot of people. By the time we left the place was full, but I had seen people come in, eat and leave before we even got food.

Fl2s66UCOxQ1TMu89pkB_A.text: Love this place.  I've been here a few times and the staff is always pleasant and the food is always good.  They have great happy hour food & drink specials.

mU4SOsPTmrpQkvNOS09LKA.text: Thanks Wally's! We've eaten with you two times his past week. You are our neighborhood go to spot. We have never had a bad meal in nearly a decade....until this week, thanks for taking the "Cajun meatloaf" away and replacing it with a staple-fish and chips! YUM! We appreciated your great service in keeping us happy. See you again soon!

2jSsP_nzC4u1OvsXOV__uA.text: Excellent food and service. Had the chicken marsala with a rich velvety marsala sauce, just right. The service from Tom was superb. Nice relaxed atmosphere, beautiful sitting on the patio tonight. Have you been here before, every time it's been great. A mix of semi fine dining and comfort food. I will definitely be back.

jYXiyQ-aYMsvbI07mxfYrA.text: I had blackened salmon salad, fish was cooked perfect, with crisp outside and perfectly cooked inside. Meatloaf was top drawer, a must if your a meat and potato lover.   The infused pineapple vodka was real nice, not strong, yet refreshing

H-i9VkVJMppv_ZsIxZt4QQ.text: This is a great family friendly place. Food is fantastic and staff is nice and personable. They always greet you with a smile and care about your experience, whether it is for happy hour or dinner with family and friends. Great location with lots of parking available. Our family has been going for many years and will continue to for many years ahead.

CgLUay8kUr8TO_6wYiy7zg.text: I love this place. I've been coming in for about 15 years and have never had a bad meal or bad service, ever. It was especially cool when Wally would bring his Mastiff to work, I loved that dog! I was raised in MT so I really love the meatloaf and the pot roast, just as good as grandma cooked. The Chinese chicken salad rocks, as does the Chicken Vesuvius. If you have a sweet tooth, be sure to order the huge chocolate cake. Yum! Thank you for your wonderful food and great service all of these years. I will be coming in for many more years.

LhMyU0Zi1hGhvIsnrVkEXg.text: Always leave here smiling. Have had most everything on the menu and haven't found anything that wasn't great. Love the corned beef and cabbage nite! Salads are all super! Love the Cuban sandwich and wash it down with a Gunners on tap! Nirvana!

DIgyjrZrxWF6iEIy7MCRxQ.text: Love Wallys!    Mac and cheese! Fish and chips!  Hummus, French Onion soup! The food is solid!   The pineapple infusion and sangria are freaking amazing!  My only issue is the limited amount of low tables.  When I go here with my parents it's not comfortable for them to be up high. There are only a few low tables inside and if it's busy you are out of luck.   Oh and Wally has some good wine!  Nice to see that at a bar.

fqKEbvJNmRqwNjJqioS31Q.text: I love this restaurant!  Beautiful patio view of little green belt area of shopping center. Just green grass and a few flowers. Why is this so hard to find in beautiful Phoenix?  Ok, food--everything is fantastic!!  Hamburger, spaghetti, salad, Rueben, brats, Spinach dip (best)....love it!  Prices reasonable. Portions perfect. Wonderful place for lunch or dinner!  ENJOY.

LprgOdAQqYT8MnEix-MgHQ.text: Wow! My first trip to Wally's .... and I got to meet Wally! Neat-O!   Not only is he the bees knees he was hands on. I was, quite frankly, surprised by that. But more on that in a minute!  To frame my experience, I popped in on a Tuesday night during the dinner rush. One of our friends had hopped on over ASAP to nab a table. (Apparently this place is hopping. She was spot on!)  It's a really cute place that is friendly to all sorts of different folks.   If you want to watch the game? Sure! TV at the bar.  Feel like eating at the bar? Yep! Casual dining? Absolutely. Dinner date (where you want to impress)? YES.   I was (not on a date) but did see a number of couples engaged in serious conversation over wine. It's not too loud of a place (at least on a Tuesday night) to foster intimate conversation.   For dinner I followed the menu's guidance (and then asked Wally himself). Chicken Vesuvius is w-o-n-d-e-r-f-u-l! Chicken medallions, artichoke hearts, kalamata olives, 'cider' smoked bacon (HOH MY) with plenty of herbs and spices. My meal was served with a hearty portion of salad and (HOH MY) horse radish mashed potatoes.  1) The chicken was cooked to perfection. Not a hint of dryness! 2) The chicken wasn't bathed in oil. That sounds like a terrible way to describe it, but, I didn't feel like I was tossing a gym session out the window.   That being said, note that portions are on the very [very] generous side. I took 2/3rd of it home.  Right. So about Wally, the impeccable service and a delightful experience... Let's see...Our server described the specials with such delight that I only wished I was going off menu. But no! I wanted something "regular" on the menu. Wally was incredibly helpful in helping this first timer navigate the full menu. (Alas, the house was out of the nightly special of ribs.) Wally has a comedic sense of timing. Watch out!  Ok, so what's the deal with Wally's fantastic beard? Were you thinking Ernest Hemingway? Why yes! In fact, Wally and his son enter a contest every year for the best E. Hemingway beard in FL.   [Drum Roll] They are 2013 crowned winners!  This is a great spot if you're popping in to AJ's. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Angela rocks it as a #bartender at a super cool #phoenix #bar #restaurant!
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Blackened Chicken &amp; Brie&#34; Panini!
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Manhattan cocktail!

iiFJ7bZUU8ocYNRp72BOCQ.text: Wally's is a gem in this area of mediocre trendy restaurants.  The service is always genuine and friendly the food just awesome.  Tried the Cabbage and Corn Beef.....perfect.   The meat loaf just like Moms.  The Chicken Parm so good.  My drink is never empty the waiters are so on top of it.

8zbCIYiemU0wKon7NGIIyQ.text: Wally's is my good ole go-to! It seems that there are very few decent straight up American restaurants in the Biltmore/Arcadia area. Whenever I'm not sure what I'm in the mood for, or don't want to be bothered with a hustle & bustle type place, Wally's it is!   Don't expect to order healthy here, their menu is more on the side of comfort food, that being said I've never had a bad meal. The portions are very generous, and the prices are reasonable. The service here is so welcoming, they treat you as if you've been coming here for years. They have great sangria and lots of decent beer on tap to go with their delicious food. My favorite dish so far has been the Prime Rib dip, it's fantastic and full of flavor, and they also have awesome fries (a mix of sweet potato and regular). This place is totally worth the cheat! I highly recommend Wally's, as it's a great local restaurant.

LAzthjQwwfomjWPynZywxg.text: Reliably delicious food in a bustling 44th Street & Camelback location. Try going at off-peak hours as this place fills up fast and gets on the noisy side. Try the escargot for an appetizer--super savory! The bangers and mash is my favorite selection for dinner.

_4zUhP_9oLsz23l2rERVOA.text: Lots of choices on the menu and delicious food! Nice seating inside or out. There wait staff is excellent and really work hard, especially when they have to run upstairs too. Overall cool bar, chill atmosphere and good drinks. White sangria was nice and refreshing. Bartenders were nice.

qpuDnQKTsfS-dKn8Mn6rbg.text: This place is simply Amaze.. Me nd my fiance came to try the food cause i was working in the next door building nd smelled the food.. words cannot describe the flavorfullness of our meals which was the  Bourbon pasta nd i had the the NY steak sandwich... Thx mommys fr the amaze service nd  keep ur jeans high an tite..

mh5qz8wV71xagNJXrONvHg.text: This place is a secret place that you have to be "in the know".  The food is so scrumptious.  I have a very hard time keeping on a diet when I'm eating at Wally's.  There are plenty of wonderful healthy foods but I just love their sweet potato fries. and their Burbon Street Pasta.  The moment you walk in you see this gorgeous long antique bar that looks straight out of Tombstone. Of course me being a "bar" connoisseur this is the place I want to sit. The staff is so wonderful. The food is the best in town.  I hope to see you there because I will be there many times.

1kHHswGDUWc48tJYccFGUA.text: Went here on a work luncheon, not expecting to see a line out the door at 1:00pm on a Wednesday.  After being sat, and greeted by our server, I could see they had a great customer service protocol as we had our drinks within 2 minutes.  I followed suit with the others and ordered their wings "Wally Style" and onion rings.  Usually with appetizers, it takes something pretty special to make me happy, but the wings were fantastic!  Crispy, flavorful, only the drums, and sauce on the side.  The onion rings were so good also, that I brought my girlfriend back that Friday to try their other food.  We started with the escargot, and then I had the bangers n' mash, and she had the fish & chips.  The entire meal was phenomenal, and the service was perfect.  Couldn't recommend more.  My new guilty place to go when I have time to enjoy my lunch during the week.

tTQqnZH2PkrDjh0OBBxRlw.text: God this place is good.  Stepping into their dinning room is like being with friends.  It's quaint and comfortable and the servers are always friendly.  As for the food, it is equally as enjoyable.  The mac n cheese is to die for and the fish n chips is the best I've had in the valley.  Their homemade tartar sauce is what really sets them apart.   It's a little tucked away, but quite the gem.

fqKuMYHL4J9GxoOfX4VZCA.text: Holy smacks!  The mac n chz dishes they have are off the hook. Everything an Irish pub should be. Will definitely be back.

cHG7BMraKjUIZfVOdzJdGA.text: Wally's bills itself as a neighborhood grill - it's in our neighborhood so we like to frequent it. The food is good and the portion sizes are enough to take some home and have the next day. I tried the french dip with prime rib for the first time and it was mighty good! I'm not a fan of liver and onions, but have been told that Wally's knows how to make it taste yummy. Great atmosphere, nice outside eating area, great menu selection. All around a good place.  We did have a strange occurance after our last visit. We went with friends and split the tab 50-50. While we were in the parking lot saying our goodbyes to our friends, the waiter came out & asked if everything was ok - if our experience was good. We all said yes, and he said he just wondered because when he gets a 10% tip, he'd like to know why. I know we gave him a nice tip - I have no idea what our friends tipped, but I thought it was incredibly rude that he would come out to question us! We've never had this experience at any eating establishment anywhere - I was really taken back. This is not indicitive of Wally's - but Wally, if you read this, please know this didn't set well with a "Wally's Club" member.

G8ojvuocrmYTZ4gom1yQVw.text: They make a hellova Cuban! You won't be sad you ordered it! Service is good and fast enough for lunch on a work day.

i80-JRdjnLTgprpminU2Vg.text: This is the best neighborhood grill & bar you can find.  Not only does it have a cool, old-school tavern feel in a great location, but the food is phenomenal. This isn't your standard pub fare. There's a chef in that kitchen preparing traditional dishes with a little extra to each one...and the daily specials are amazing. Dad's Fried Chicken with HMP and a homemade biscuit...yum!  The S'macs are killer!

dCxEY0oqK9fldYiT2NeXvA.text: Visited last nite after a brief stint at nearby gym.  We sat on the patio,  Great service, good food.  I had NY strip Caesar salad, with martini.  Steak was done perfectly.   GF had Cobb salad with white wine.   We hardly noticed the 3 pregnant women with the 3 toddlers running all over :).  Can't begrudge them for wanting good food!

mSIW9l1EaJX9LBGRaeH1Xw.text: This has been on my "to try" list for ages. We live down the street, we need a watering hole, and most importantly one that allows dogs. We found it. I almost don't want to shout out the rave reviews too loudly because it's so cool and I don't want to attract any uncool-ness with rave reviews. But I do want to give props to a terrific establishment.  The interior is beautiful, I love the lofty feel over the bar. The crowd was a nice mix and good representation of our Arcadia hood. Not too rowdy, not too stiff. The ambiance was set up very well, with a little sports flair but casual dining as well away from TVs.  The waitstaff is attentive and genuine. The food was above-average pub fare with plenty of veg options for us meatless mongers. The only minus was that while the patio allows dogs, not ALL areas of the patio are dog friendly according to our host. So we had to sit away from the bulk of table and couldn't sit under the heaters (which also apparently couldn't be moved). It was 50* out and pretty chilly, so I'll plan for that next time.

l7T13uGPfXfT6_hMLRydzg.text: This review is about rude, rude Wally. First off, as my 80 year old mother and I were coming in slowly, he said "hurry up, old lady."  The food was ok, frankly not one thing to talk about.  A $10 - $14 burgers and salad kind of joint.  My son ordered the halibut special. The bill for a plate with some rice, green beans, and a piece of halibut was $26.95!!!!! I told Wally I thought that was too expensive for a restaurant like his. His response was, "I guess you haven't eaten in a restaurant lately." well, Wally, no way am I stepping back in yours.

8mh_Dm4_5-DMGBbTJo8Xyg.text: I was expecting this place to be better than it was based on reviews. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. The burgers were just "ok" - nothing special and nothing great. Actually, both my husband and I ordered the bacon cheese burger and BOTH of us originally thought they had forgotten the cheese. It ended up being there, but was such a small amount that you couldn't even taste it. Our daughters had the chicken fingers, which were pretty good, but also not anything phenomenal. Probably the best part of the meal were the sauces. The BBQ sauce on my burger (I got it "rodeo style" - with BBQ and onion strings) was really tasty, and the ranch that the chicken was served with was delicious. Tasted really fresh and homemade - they should bottle and sell that stuff! The burgers? Meh - I could take it or leave it. Certainly not worth a special out-of-your-way trip or anything.

86hslXtdkXZCH2Q464KZPQ.text: This place is amazing. They have great portions and great staff. The place is very classy and in a great location. Try the creme brulee - you will not regret it.

TSlNMZaNinySU2GR76hFFQ.text: My work colleagues and I stumbled onto this rare gem of the desert while on a business trip. After a long day of work, we jumped into our car and decided to drive to a restaurant close to our hotel. We took a chance on Wally's and were all astounded by the food quality and fantastic service we received on our visit. Everything was great! It was so good that we broke all road warrior tradition and actually went back to the same place to eat dinner the next three nights instead of exploring other options like we normally do! If you want great comfort food that is prepared elegantly and simply, check out Wally's. Some personal favorites of mine and our team: Pot Roast, The French Onion Soup is legendary, the fish was great (go figure considering it is in the middle of the desert), all the mac and cheese dishes were fantastic. The food servers are very accommodating, and the owner is always kind and willing to accomidate even quirky requests. Enjoy!

Or2Z7FH0ZklQlggxUF3kBA.text: My family and I are regulars at Wally's because at Wally's, regulars are family.  Beyond the deep, deep personal connection I have with the restaurant I can tell you that the food is unquestionably great and the service is always top-notch. (There are a few servers and bartenders who have been there since the place opened 10 years ago.)   My favorite menu items are as follows: 1) Cuban Panini 2) Frisco Burger 3) Meatloaf 4) Pot Roast 5) Spaghetti. The fact that Wally's can do all five of those things extremely well should tell you all you need to know.  There is something old school cool about a joint where the Proprietor is almost always present and Wally's is that place. He's the guy with the grey hair and beard who probably handed you your menu. Tell him I said hello and that the Price family loves him like their own.

ICIWnK-FkHkQ26Q_gqYh3Q.text: Chose this place at the last minute based on. Yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. The restaurant is similar to a sports bar theme but you can sit either inside or out. We arrived a little late, so it wasn't very crowded. I ordered a cheddar burger "rodeo style" which means it had onion straws and BBQ sauce on it. It was cooked perfectly, was very juicy and delicious. My wife had the fish and chips which was also outstanding. Overall, the service was great, the food was very good and the price was reasonable. I would recommend this place.

LTQRbugcxgbiFbzRZbTmYw.text: Just spent $25 for cold wings and two beers. If I wanted leftovers I would have stayed home for free!

ECIa0O-YultZ5CmEHiYHnw.text: Great 1st time experience.  Our waitress was knowledgeable and friendly.  We enjoyed the 3-6 happy hour menu.  Food was excellent!  We came from Cave Creek and will come again!  Worth the drive!!

PrnNx7ggQ4YJqjjqSM_hTg.text: I have been dining at Wally's for the past several years.   Wally's has great food and drink served by super friendly people in a family friendly enviroment.  The prices are also very reasonable.    Wally's is the Best  casual dining experience in the Valley.    You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu but for lunch I recommend the smoked turkey sandwich or fish and chips.  For those of you that like burgers, the Wally burger is great.    For dinner the chicken parmesan is outstanding.  I also really like their chicken marcello.  Wally just also opened a second location in Scottsdale.    If your lucky, you may even run into Wally.

FQ4xq9pfNThKF4WwGafgnA.text: Best place in town for Friday night Prime Rib!

JOSfeq5KmakyCVQui5TcMw.text: Just outstanding food & service. Specializes in mainly classic dishes.  One of the best spots in the valley--compared to any other.

z5Hzf0Thnqta0XYhaKR5dg.text: One of our favorite pubs in the Arcadia area. Nothing disappoints! Always friendly service and clientele. Even as busy as at is Sunday evenings the service was quick and friendly.  The best thing about this place is the food is consistently good.

Kj6K8DW2enbSF9AWiqLbcw.text: We ordered fish and chips and a chicken sandwich.  Three stars because the chicken was severely undercooked and service unfriendly..  Sent chicken back and ordered fish as my husband said it was good.  It was good.  The tarter sauce was too sweet.  Fries were fine.  Overall the food is expensive for casual fare, $40 for lunch.  This will not be a regular spot for us.

Xrd8h59m40I-k8XmxlKnRw.text: We had a great experience at Wally's!  The prime rib dip was the best I have had outside of my own home in a very long time. The beef stroganoff was delicious with a very generous portion of tender beef. Our server was excellent- offering suggestions, keeping our drinks full and otherwise being attentive. The staff looked like they enjoyed working there which set the mood as soon as we walked in. Food was a little pricey, but no complaints due to the quality and quantity. Will definitely return!

S6ELASSVMGga7_9cB_l0IQ.text: Bacon Three Cheese Pasta.  There are not words capable of expressing how delicious this dish is.  The explosion of flavor in every bite keeps me coming back to Wallys.  Add some buffalo wings and a cold beer for the perfect meal and enjoy the friendly company of Wallys staff.

Inpp5ymFxmcx0-zLbevYXw.text: Local to the area folks really like it, but I find the food very average and extremely boring. Very forgettable. I do remember I had a Cobb Salad last month, and it was average, and I couldn't even remember more. It shouldn't be like that.

4fBYmwcydduBNJI5IdNw3Q.text: Great neighborhood restaurant!  I have never had a bad meal or bad service here. When you walk in you are warmly greeted like an old friend and no matter how packed they are they always find a table to accommodate you. The menu has lots to choose from; burgers, sandwiches, salads, soups (french onion is my favorite), entrees (chicken pot pie or fish n chips are scrumptious), and great desserts as well. The atmosphere is charming and fun; perfect place for lunch or dinner.

ooawFyr5UiqrZBpgm1JbsA.text: The location is prime and the decor is neat, but the staff is horrendous! From the second we walked in we were treated as second class. The greeting with the hostess was odd but when the lack of communication continued things just felt uncomfortable. Severs would come to the table to drop something off or fill water, after saying thank you they'd look at me and turn walking away without saying a word. We noticed that it wasn't just one ill trained associate but every person there refused to say 'your welcome' or even acknowledge my expression of appreciation. We came to the conclusion that they must literally train their employees this way because every person in the establishment treated us this way. We paid with separate checks, and to top it off they charged the wrong cards. Meaning they literally had to take the card out of the opposite bill fold and charge it to the wrong check.   They seem to cater more toward the older crowd, as staff seemed extremely friendly with these patrons. The fact that we are both under the age of 40 seemed to have contributed to our poor treatment.   I can assure you I will not be returning and I urge you to save yourself an awful experience and dine or drink somewhere else as well!

3pcbbYkkBFKYTrJ1TA8-Sg.text: Tonight was our first time here. The entire atmosphere is welcoming and very well done-it devote takes you away to a different place. It actually reminded my husband and I of some of the cute spots we dined at in Europe.  Our server was sweet and attentive, offering recommendations and being. Patient when our party simply couldn't decide what to eat from the awesome menu.   The food-where do I begin-it was all great! We started with wings. As suggested, we ordered them extra crispy with the sauce on the side as suggested and were not disappointed. Good flavor and perfectly cooked. The beer was ice cold. For entrees, it was definitely hard to decide. Their menu is varied with dishes that frankly l look great. We ordered bangers and mash, a prime rib dip sandwich, short ribs, and chicken Marsala. We all tasted everything and he food was all great. I also started with a cup of heir onion soup which was by far, the best I ever had. Perfectly cooked and seasoned and good portions. We are already planning on going back. Great experience all around- a True gem.

Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b1qgfn4R-NHSedi77TIoVQ.text: I probably shouldn't give this place five stars because that would mean it is perfect and someone is giving you a foot rub and waving a palm frond over your head to keep you cool. But short of that, this place is a sanctuary for the traveler or resident who wants great food, a cool drink, and a place that will remind them of good pubs from the east coast, downtown London, or, well, Phoenix. If you want a burger or something hand crafted and with the word 'infused' they have it along with reasonable prices, and welcome wait staff. They might be a little short on 'after dinner' drinks or desserts that require fire, but what REAL American does their drinking after dinner and eats flaming ice cream anyways? We will leave that to the French.   Do yourself and that visiting family member a favor and take yourself and them here. You won't regret it.

fkTJPyuk705wZrZXDgEwIw.text: I really hate to give a terrible review to Wally's, but there is one area in which I draw the line; and that is when an owner/manager is disrespectful.  Our bicycling group has been going to Wally's every Tuesday for at least several years.  We usually are a group of 10-20 that call ahead to reserve an outside table EVERY WEEK.  The service tonight was horrible, and I do not blame the server AT ALL, I blame the owner/manager.    Quite a few members of our group have worked in the "service industry" in the past, and we understand and commiserate with the difficulties of serving large groups.  We were patient and polite with our server, even with missed orders and extremely slow service.   We always tip the server well, because it is our belief that it is the fault of the owners when they don't provide enough servers to adequately cover the patrons without feeling overworked.   However, the owner/manager, Matt, felt it necessary to come to our table as we were finishing up paying to chastise us. I don't know that I have ever had an owner come to the table to express what bad customers we had been.  He stood at our table and told us that "this didn't work tonight," and that, in the future, "we could all figure out our bill and anyone who didn't want to order food can come up to the bar to order and pay themselves."  He also went on to say that "regular tables had to wait" and "that staff comes first."  What are we if not regular customers?  If I was a restaurant and bar owner who had a large group coming every week spending a significant amount of money, I would be grateful and welcoming.  I would make sure that I had enough wait staff to cover the busy happy hour time period, or HELP OUT MYSELF.  As I was waiting 20 minutes for my first beer, I looked in through the window and saw Matt standing at the register.  I turned to my husband and said, "I wonder why he hasn't stepped up to help."    I know that you are a well-established restaurant with a regular clientele, and may not need to be welcoming towards our group.  However, please think about the message that you sent to a group of twenty regular customers, that we weren't deserving of good service or respect.  There are many other establishments that we can frequent in the area, I only hope that you listen to what I have said and respond.

4hEiFSm-Qw4ZQdylyemviQ.text: This place is perfect for a casual lunch. It's within a beautiful little plaza and the food does not disappoint. Although the tables are a little close together, it wasn't a problem because it wasn't packed when I went. The server was very attentive and she even left a carafe of diet coke on the table for us. We order the spinach as an appetizer and it was very tasty. We also split the mac and cheese and the mushroom and bleu cheese burger. The mac and cheese was amazing, I could've eaten it all day! The burger was cooked perfectly and I liked the mixed of regular fries with sweet potato fries and onion rings. I would definitely come back and recommend Wally's to my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deliciously cheesy mac and cheese
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom and bleu cheese burger

aw4NXUGMBNT8OhdnWeoKBA.text: Enjoyed the prime rib sandwich recommended by the manager & shared pasta bacon dish with heavy cheese sauce. Interesting classic pub decor . Popular local pub nestled in rear  of Whole Foods older gentrified mall next to poplar Villages of Camelback Raquetclub & Spa.

Y8fLAIhlL06vuipqoX-51g.text: The food was excellent!  Everyone we had dinner with had been there before except my son and I.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  The others we were with said hey have never had a bad meal here.  I had the chicken Vesuvius (not sure if I spelled that right).  Sooo good!  Really great portions and prices were reasonable.  Highly recommend!

TKDV2eifT9ZxB4LFyyj60g.text: My overall favorite restaurant for down-home food, service, and relaxation.   I trust the servers to steer me in the right direction.   The Mgr is engaging and the food is consistent.   Our daughter loves the SMACs, my wife loves the beet salad, and I prefer the sandwiches or prime rib.   My only comment is I wish they had a larger on-tap beer selection.

oF6vKmodhdBWOxrCFPrWTg.text: I think you will really like this pub, I got a grilled cheese, and boy was it delicious, I ate every bite! I liked sitting outside, when its just warm enough, enjoying your food out there will make you feel happy as a clam! service was great too, food was awesome!

lh0B5vCuqT3-ZwZ_6k-P5A.text: Best veggie burger in town! Casual comfort food with a great selection of wine and drinks!

CRrVGYPPs1crjCHB7wf3kw.text: Wally's is our favorite neighborhood restaurant. We eat here at least once a week and the food is always fantastic, no matter what you order (the burgers, wedge salad, and Bourbon Street pasta are some of our favorites)! Not to mention the manager Matt is the most friendly and accommodating guy in the business. He makes a point to visit with patrons and make a personal connection that puts Wally's over the top!

hHD4BvBceXRpL8AqvK4DPg.text: I saw this place yesterday because it's next to my new nail spot, Ken's (highly recommend) I went back home and scooped up the fiance to come back here for a nice leisurely Sunday lunch....What an excellent choice! Service was great and very informative and attentive (didn't get the blonde servers name) We started off with a ceasar salad and it was delish.. I got the meatloaf meal and it was awesome!  Really delish...my only regret was that I wish we would have shared it...it's huge and well worth it. My fiance got the peppers and sausage mac and cheese...although delicious, it was scarce on the peppers and bell pepper. Cute cute spot and has nice patio area too.. A new spot for us for sure..

mv6ykG7tRgydRV93VsHnEQ.text: My husband and I stopped in this restraurant recently where my husband has been to to watch sports but this was my first visit. We don't live close but we will definitely make the trip back soon. I had the prime rib special and it was flavorful and tender. My husband had the liver since I won't cook it. He enjoyed his meal as well.    We found the staff professional but very friendly and the service excellent and quick.

PMU-ZzCFJW_gufxAVlsyxQ.text: Omg best freaking macaroni in my life  please get the classic cheeseburger Smac!  This was my first time going here and it wasn't even planned but I'm damn sure glad we went!   We were seated right away walking thru the dining area seeing the bar and sat outside,  Our waitress was cool she put her input on what she thought was good     Overall great experience i loveeeeed the food!!!!

mZ7Pbb0KSn352xfzItysCQ.text: Wow. Wandered in just to grab a HH drink and was blown away. Try the blue cheese escargot!

3dHfPtdTkXOPQ9mf1NezrQ.text: Don't order the pot roast.  It definitely does NOT taste like mom's!  I believe they use some sort of a pre-cooked, frozen product.  It's actually a bit gamey tasting.  Their food is fair, to acceptable.  I guess the lure of the restaurant is more the charm/ambience more so than the quality of their offerings.  Drink pours are WEAK.  Owner and son don't take constructive criticism very well.  A bit angry if you ask me.:-)

knEiPGGMR-v5i7elLQYzbg.text: I can always rely on Wally's for a great dinner. Their pot roast is absolutely to die for, and they have a great selection of other foods. The staff is friendly, and they're in a great location. My only complaint is that it's a bit crowded, but I'd say that just adds to the authentic-ness (is that a word? Ha) of being a pub.

YfFeb88Qrq_j6BJlX17FwQ.text: Excellent restaurant. The french onion soup is probably the best in the city. We've taken friends and family there over the past few months and have never been disappointed. The burgers, salads, fish and chips and meatloaf are incredible.

lFget-aT09-C8WC_p0L9WQ.text: Always a fan of Wally's. Garlic blue cheese escargot delicious! Great wine menu and amazing dining options. Check them out!

EgKoGu2ApD2bHBHyBQrQdA.text: Fantastic surprise, great service, delicious food, nice outdoor patio. Our server Jake B. was the best. Really liked the environment, combination of families, end of day golfers, and folks wanting a relaxed atmosphere without obnoxiously loud music blaring out their conversation. Will be back again soon. Good luck Jake with Pharm. school!

XpjpRXf_Avjd5FzlJ_luIQ.text: Have you ever gone into a restaurant where the meal exceeded your expectations? Well, this one did for my wife and myself. I can only speak for what we ordered, but I'm sure the rest of the menu is pretty darn good too. Our super personable waitress was Alison. She recommended the French Dip and the Meatloaf. OUTSTANDING! Never would have guessed they both would be so flavorful and just really really good. Thank you "Check Please" for reviewing Wally's. We agree with your fantastic review.  The portions are huge, the place is very nice, and the wait staff   ( talking about you Alison) is wonderful. Oh yeah, we'll be back!

eyolJElM8qbNI8rc-m_UWA.text: We went to WALLY's this weekend for the first time great location great patio and welcoming entrance but a good experience stopped at the door when we are greeted by the bartender who didn't seem like he wanted to be working memorial day weekend ....my wife and her girlfriend struggled to decide which table they like to sit at...even though the place was empty they were trying to figure out which was the best table just like women do ....while waiting for them to make a decisiin our bartender host came out with the sarcastic comment "it's not right Really that hard"... the mood had been set. He then performed his tasks as if on auto pilot and not making us really feel welcomed.  When I asked him if he had any fresh brewed iced tea or if it came out of a gun behind the bar he had a dead look on his face then when I asked him if he had any sugar in the raw for the tea he just repeated the two types of teas that he had and told me "all we have is what you see" pointing to the sugar bowl ....this guy really didn't want to be here ....later I found a hair in my salad and I didn't even mention it feeling this guy wouldn't really care. When I asked him to remove my finished plate he blew right by me. Then when he came back to get it didn't bother asking me how I liked it even though I left a third of it on the plate. Would never go back here. By the way I should mention that my wife's burger was good but are the fries were uneventful I had a chicken Caesar salad and asked for replacement of balsamic vinaigrette which I got but for some reason the chef drenched it and I mean drenched it in balsamic dressing ...very disappointing for a $45.00 (PLUS TIP!) lunch for a burger, salad, two iced teas and Mr Sourpuss.

0dMYeWUQfmHkfmox58PAnQ.text: A fun and eclectic English style pub, too bad the tables look like White Castle brothel sheets, ( see pic below). There classic dishes out emphasized in green, so I ordered the Cajun chicken pasta. The sauce was watery, the aspect of Cajun was lost, and the pasta was undercooked - I'm not a "sender backer", but this almost caused me to be caustic. The Pinot Grigio, which is an Italian, is lemony as Pledge - I don't recommend unless you've done the Tide Pod Challenge. My mate ordered the Wally burger and it was the size of a slider and even though he order all garnishment on the side, it was piled together like a tenement on the East end of London. If you like theme restaurants, subpar service, and just like to waste time and money - Wally's is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filthy table cloths that lazy staff cannot be predisposed to change each time - is that a health violation?
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior posed as a pub - no place in England would look like this, unless it was burnt down.

kahrz_vor40tXqEZAy7iyA.text: This used to be my neighborhood place to eat and enjoy; however over the course of several months, service, quality, and caring for customers is None and void.    We came back this evening to eat dinner and also order take out for the entire family and the food was okay, but customer service failed.  The bartender (B-th) that was serving us, told us they didn't have what we would want to order as an after dinner drink ----  it's a full bar---right?    Oh wait, either she had a great friend or a new hook up at the end of the bar that weighs over paying customers....one time, ok - two times, eeehhh - maybe the place is going through challenges ---- three times --- " not going back " ----- fourth time I'll give it another try - ummmmm -  that's it - pricey with HORRIFIC customer service?  Not ok.... go to a place that has excellent customer service and amazing food - like Wink 24 (local) or Deici --- right down the street - YELP IT!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. servers attention-this is where our service was-perhaps I should have been asking the customer for something, may have gotten further.
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left a note ---- had to as the bartender/server wasn&#39;t &#34;present&#34;.

_s0B5OPDLhG0qV11EJdftw.text: We have been here multiple times!  Food is always beyond spot on! Service is always friendly and attentive! Great happy hour 7 days a week! Gotta try the grilled artichoke! We've tried lots off the menu and everything is incredible!

S4IhJXJfpjMIDwhCoLWB2w.text: Best liver & onions in Phoenix as far as I'm concerned! I've nearly given up on finding a decent preparation that isn't cooked to the consistency of leather or completely tasteless but this place has perfected the dish! I've now been in three times and it never gets old. The staff are all down to earth and friendly and the food is plain awesome. The Irish pub feel makes it all that much more charming. I'll be back for sure.

8kwVcRoH_8tZaVmIkCBz6g.text: A fellow Yelper mentioned she liked the liver and onions here so I gathered up a crew that I knew most of them liked liver and onions tried this place. Before going I looked at the menu and found they had beef stroganoff which may even be rarer in restaurants than liver and onions. I settled for a bit of liver and got the stroganoff. I am pretty sure that was the best stroganoff I have had in a restaurant. Several folks tried the French Onion soup and liked it. Some of our party arrived early for our reservation, one on crutches, and they were seated promptly with out having to wait until we were all there. Even though they were packed the service was good and we got our food in a reasonable amount of time. The only negative is between AJ's and several popular restaurants all on the same property parking is really hard to come by.

lPzSLMuQ-2X2VMmsFUj4cg.text: Great pub with EXCELLENT food!  My wife and I live nearby and we have enjoyed nearly every dish we've had here.  I particularly enjoy the baby back rib special available on Sundays.

qRKEGCkhPL07ml_vXd1iMw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat. Consistently delicious every time and the beer is ice cold. My go to is the prime rib dip sandwich. Is rare to find places like this that have good prices. Next to steak 44

NsW1RnhaRgvCexV2Q2GIUA.text: Great food and atmoshpere.  The patio is amazing as well.

Y9gC8UCn6h-eiqdEMY73BQ.text: Cute place. Seems like a happening spot. Very busy for a Tuesday. Great part of Scottsdale. They have a bread pudding for desert. The ribs were amazing; melt in your mouth. They have Smithwicks on tap oh yeah.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xcw3dRaOIxuoeJPHYSwu4g.text: Went on NYE and had a 5:30 reservation , we arrived at 5:05 and were told by Wally himself, we had to sit at a high top. I'm with my 80'year old mother and that wouldn't work well. I repeated I have a reservation and he told me , I have large parties tonight and will seat you at a regular table if you can be gone in an hour!!!!!!!!! He was rude and simply could not have cared less about our two top. We should have left! How this man is in hospitality is beyond me. We watched him w other patrons and he was great with his regulars . Moral of story, if you're not in the know of Wally get ready to be treated like crap. The food was ok, nothing great , noodles over cooked with the stroganoff dish. Service was fine. No reason to ever return. Oh and as we left, there were still empty tables. Thanks for nothing Wally , you get worst restaurant treatment from an owner trophy ....

EIGwTSuXD8jLazzB50SUag.text: This is a calm, neighborhood version of an Irish pub with a typically older crowd. Look at the people as wisdom. They know good food. It also helps out with the local neighborhood vibe. Whether it be an artichoke, meatball sandwich, mac n cheese or bread pudding (if you sense a theme in the food, not a location for the faint of heart), the full menu is great. It's definitely hearty, comfort food but there is a good variety to choose from. The only complaint I've heard, was about one of the salads.

otVBJjaS8q5AC5G6s9UorQ.text: I come here when I know I want to have some really good food. I've been to this place quite a few times and every single time every meal I've ordered has been beyond flavorful and delicious. I often have a hard time choosing what I want to eat. They have a huge variety of food anywhere from sandwiches to pasta to steak. It's priced perfect for the quality and quantity you're given. Every single staff member here is friendly, and they go above and beyond to make sure you're having a pleasant experience while dining there. This is overall the best restaurant in Phoenix. (I would highly recommend the meatball sandwich or a Wally burger)

joa9PQKFWStewmIDtDzKXg.text: Wally's is fab. The decoration is like a classy den with some memorabilia and Americana, but nothing overbearing or tacky. Very casual and convenient, the bartenders are very friendly, and the place is seemingly run by people all very comfortable and familiar with each other (something I really like). Great beers on tap, some super wines, and the food is above average (lots of variety... think Village Tavern with an edge). It's popular with Arcadia residents, but is still politely tucked away, so you rarely have to worry about the crowds. They also stay open until everyone leaves, so getting a big party in late may not be a problem.

qsZNzP7IulKk6PW2V9-vEw.text: Not a bad place to eat. A little pricey for what you get. Nice location with a patio. Good place for happy hour.

XXPtiNwzdJh-FDzKtr5CGg.text: Where everybody knows your name.  Very refreshing to be waited on by Wally himself, I'll come back for the we serve mostly "regulars" feeling you get.  I don't think enough people know about this place but those that do come back for more.  The Cuban is my lunch of choice and the beer selection is perfect for happy hour.

LOOSb57cjzy7kfRSggnUUA.text: This is a great neighborhood bar and grill.  It is your basic menu with some surprises and daily dinner and soup specials .  I always seem to get the same things every time I go... I either like the London Beef Dip with fries (fries come with a mixture of regular and sweet potato fries which are yummy) or if I am looking for something a little lighter I love their chopped salad.  They make a house sangria that is fantastic and they also make their own infused pineapple vodka which is very tasty too.

IaFod8R21KFL_xE2dNPivw.text: We rode our bikes here ther other night and had a wonderful time and dinner for two + 2 drinks for $25. The food was very fresh and the patio is great. The "hold in the wall" feeling Nikki talks about is dead on! Try it out sometime when you just don't know where to go!

p_3jBOKpbVOlq_jjBNXXdA.text: This is for Wally's American Pub/Grill over on Double Tree Ranch Road in Scottsdale - just off Scottsdale Road.  Very good food and a delightfully designed restaurant.  Excellent for a casual meal or for bringing business clients. The food is first-rate!

tZX1wg9-5rbZbcbH1ZkM7g.text: Our waitress and the burgers were great! Started with the spicy wings that were spicy but sooooo tasty. Buttons and bleu burger was delicious and the fries were a mix of regular and sweet potato all in. One yummy mound. They even included an onion ring on the top. Perfection! Give this place a try.

Zc4gDZLNpSX5CRqvMO-0qA.text: My dad saw this restaurant featured on "Check Please", and even though it's in walking distance from where I live, I'd never been! My mom, dad and I went for dinner last week and it was delightful. We met the owner and he was very nice, and our server was really attentive and polite as well. The food was really good -- I had a mixed green salad, burger, and the fries that are 50/50 sweet potato and regular (love that you can do that!). My parents both got pasta and loved it. You could tell the owner knew just about every person that walked in; a real family-owned place. Will definitely be back!

YHMcXjoeeap_ySu9uz-vag.text: we just came for an adult beverage.  Roman (bartender) was amazing- great conversation and made sure our waters and beverages were full.  Food looked great but we didn't try anything.   We will be back when we our on that side of town.
