0RULQpNGsYBpJV2oDy-orQ.text: This is a proper pub...  if you are from England and want to feel at home.  This is your spot, food and everything is ok but it's the total package that gets this place a 4/5.   Enjoy

SF7_Bvktwp4oYmfRhxk83Q.text: This Wally's should not be confused with Wally's American Gastropub which I did at first.  We went for happy hour, 3 to 6 P. M. on Saturday, a rarity for many restaurants. Any draft beer is $4, any app is $8 and any burger is $9. We ordered a Rodeo and a Frisco burger. I subbed the fries for a mixed green salad with a $1 addition. The quality of the food and service were both quite good. Our outdoor seating was pleasant with cooperating weather. There was some traffic noise from 44th Street, but not intrusive enough to hinder conversation. It is hard for me to characterize because it is unique. It isn't really a pub or a bar or a grill or a Mom and Pop diner, but perhaps best described as an amalgam of all four. It's an older establishment with the men's restroom used as a store room, but I would definitely recommend trying it.

HXZSD7WbmaZeOqtsNq5ojw.text: Wally's is right in our hood, so if you're looking for a good, local spot to sit at the bar for a drink and a bite this is it. Ramon is a great bartender and also enjoy chatting with him. Their daily specials are always delicious, and so much food that two can usually split! plus comes with salad and dessert. Always a great option, and who doesn't want dessert?! Also, their pineapple infused vodka is one of my favorites to sip on! Infused in house and divine! When the weather is nice, the patio is also a good option.

67Bdv3TlsmBDxc6dVHkV1g.text: Had the prime rib dip and was in heaven. Great atmosphere and solid service. Also ordered the sangria and was pleased with it. Would definitely come back and try out some more items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib dip was very juicy. There&#39;s a lot on this menu to try and the place has a great atmosphere.

idRq9HtWcHAxTE_gYa_Mqw.text: I've ordered from Wally's before on Postmates & thought the food was so good, so it was about time for me to come in. It's a small cozy feel to this restaurant with a bar. The menu has so many things that I want in my belly, lol.. I ordered the quesadilla this time which was good, but I should've really went with the pot roast again because it's amazing! My husband ordered meatloaf & mashed potatoes with the veggies. I of course couldn't resist to take a few bites. So yummy!! For dessert we got a ginger and pear pie I had to stop myself from eating as much as I really wanted to eat. It was delicious! They do have a Happy Hour by the way so check them out. The shopping center that they're in has lots of cute shops too! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2mepRskoYL3Em0gcxa5H-A.text: I drive by Wally's on my way to work every day and always wondered if it was good. Then my husband and I saw it featured on Check Please and decided to give it a go. It didn't disappoint! We sat on the outdoor patio which was quiet and relaxing. We didn't see much of the inside of the restaurant so I can't comment on that. Our server was prompt and friendly. We both started with a cup of the caramelized vidalia onion and Guinness soup. I'm a lover of French onion soup, and this one was very good! The cheese was melted and stringy, but not goopy. There were plenty of onions and the top was bubbly and crusted, as it should be. For my main course, I had one of the s'macs. It was fantastic! If you like mac and cheese, definitely try one of the s'macs. I had the bread pudding for dessert. It wasn't the best bread pudding I've had, but it did the trick and was a very large portion. I would definitely return to Wally's again.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato and torn basil s&#39;mac
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White chocolate bread pudding

ot0AwQ0TACjDtPCLVk8YWA.text: I have always been a big fan of Wally's! I almost always get the Pot Roast dish. The pot roast itself is very tender. You can easily cut it with a fork. It has great flavor and is covered in red wine au jus that is thick and almost gravy like! The pot roast is served with horseradish mashed potatoes. I'm a super big fan of horseradish so I also order an  side of horseradish to add to the potatoes and pot roast. It's also served with mixed veggies. I always think the veggies look so boring but they are actually really tasty. It's a mix of squash, broccoli, snap peas, green beans, carrots and peppers. They must be covered in butter because they taste way better than any veggie I ever make. The dish is $17 and it's a huge portion size. It so tasty that despite it's size, I'm always able to finish it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot Roast

OnPLIf0oCczQuaKohD54vw.text: What a great find.  First time here my wife had the cobb salad with grilled shrimp which was absolutely amazing. And I had a very unique grilled chicken Brie and tomato panini that was just fantastic. The chicken was so moist.  For a starter we had the cumin seasoned chicken quesadilla absolutely perfect

ZZGZw2fH6jt2ODr7vR7MHA.text: I had an amazing salmon salad at Wally's today! The place was cozy and our large group was able to talk to each other without yelling across the room. I'm docking a star for cleanliness and because there were flies all over inside. Which is just not appetizing.

BAhYWkzt0lWMvaLqikgyBA.text: I was in Scottsdale last week for a conference so I walked here from the nearby Hyatt for some dinner and to clear the cobwebs. Other reviewers on yelp had said it was good and they did not lie. It's a typical looking pub themed restaurant and the waiters are quick, friendly and helpful. I ordered a few peel and eat shrimp off of the happy hour menu and they were huge. The dipping sauce was amazing. My entree was the fish and chips which came with a generous portion of coke slaw. It all was delicious and they know how to make great fries. There is a patio with misting fans but it was cooler inside and comfortable. Prices were reasonable and lots of choices for happy hour. There's nothing here not to like and if I lived closer I'd be here all the time.

xjXgNS6hM7gLAjLn6VoOhQ.text: We came here after walking by several times and seeing how cute and English the atmosphere is. Being a big English fan I wanted to try it out and it definitely gave me that nostalgic feeling. The food was really good, and definitely plenty to share. Next time we will getting a plate to share, for sure.

e8Sx-dwS9o11F0gz5PUX9g.text: Love this place. First time to review it. If you've been to any BnG's in the Midwest you get that same feeling when you enter this place, like it had literally been plucked out of an Midwestern city, its cozy and feels like home. The restaurant Has seating options both inside and out. The menu is more than just "bar food" and has some delish home style menu items like pot roast and meat loaf which are both very good. The burgers are phenomenal and the desserts are all amazing. On my most recent visit we had the ginger apple pie and I almost forgot my name it was that good.   If you're in the area try this place, if you're not in the area you still need to try this place! Just do it.

hYmeKEhVMpA4GMUFqAc_qA.text: Wally's is trending in the wrong direction. Our last two visits have been less than stellar. It mostly the kitchen to blame. The front of house service is fine, but the food has been a big miss. I had fish and chips yesterday. It was super greasy and had no seasoning on the fish or in the batter which was way to thick. My cole slaw was super warm and I worry that someone will get sick from it. The French fries are really good but I can get good fries at McDonalds for $2.  My wife's Chop Chop Salad was made incorrectly twice. We complained the first time and then just gave up after that. They serve it in a cold bowl but the ingredients were a bit on the warm side. The chicken was rubbery and contained too much gristle.  We see the food execution get ignored so often with mature restaurants. I expect that is what is happening at Wally's.

0YjZG45Zpqm9TG2oheNQgA.text: Came on a Sunday afternoon 104. We wanted to sit outside and no one was outside so I asked the owner if she would turn on the misters for us, and she was more than happy to do so. Ramon was a great bartender and waiter and did a great job with my very particular French martini! I highly recommend Wally's and their salads are excellent.

52OmTvhtZPv1DpwYKEqGMw.text: I love their happy hour! Good food and lots of it.  The HH burgers and wings are my favorites!  Drinks are great too. Love love the Pineapple infused vodka!

rFgE1vMB1LbGL3gKU1t_Qw.text: Invited a friend who hadn't been here before to join me for a patio lunch.  I usually get the French dip, but was craving shrimp so I went for the Caesar salad with a healthy topping of grilled shrimp.  Usually a salad doesn't cut it for me as I am usually hungry well before dinner, but Wally is very generous with his portions.  It was so tasty, I are every bite!  She got the dip sandwich & loved it, too.  Our server, Tom, was great.  Only downside to Wally's, it is in a nice shopping area.  I was unable to make it from the restaurant to my car without popping into a boutique & dropping $95 on a cute shirt.  This has happened before, but I'll continue visiting Wally whenever it's time to treat myself.  I've sampled everything from their meatball sub to the pot roast when I'm starving.  Always good food & service.  Thanks Wally!!

6TtXNGQ1EAzbjuw60FzuLg.text: Dining with a group here was quite a pleasant experience and our group had no problem being seated immediately, thanks to a reservation made by Scott W. who organized this dinner gathering. Service was efficient, especially considering that it was a busy evening at the restaurant. It seems to me that this is one of the few establishments that does liver and onions right: perfectly cooked and seasoned, with minimal breading; it is served over mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables,the perfect sides for this dish. Seating was a bit tight but since this is a very popular restaurant, that is an unavoidable consequence of having lots of seats in a moderately sized, not huge, space. Parking is a bit of an issue at the front of the building, but additional spaces are available at the back.

IcJqefIjYIiy2L7k7-DDAQ.text: The bartender was pretty clueless last night. During happy hour she spent five minutes stocking the beer cooler with her back to the bar. When she finished did she check to see if anyone needed a drink? No, she checked her phone by the register and sent a text. Only then did she come down the bar to ask for my order.  I asked what was on happy hour and she rattled off a few beers and stopped. I stared at her and asked about cocktails. Only then did she mention the spirits on HH.  I ended up with a margarita which was pretty mediocre.

Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1-pxzexmYt0wAOLZDVEPBg.text: Solid menu! Great food and good atmosphere. Everything that I have had here has been delicious. Burgers, Fish & Chips, and Escargot are all delicious. The fruit infused vodka is a must try.

z5jGYHkbI_zXAKuMnrCmBA.text: My dynamic trio (me, fiancee and a friend), who always seem to frequent happy hour together at new places, checked out Wally's last night after a hair appointment at Moments Salon (a couple doors down).   We were seating right away at around 7pm, the place was packed (and LOUD) inside, so we opted for the patio, which turned out to be a bit warm until the misters kicked on at the pizza place across the sidewalk. Ha! But hey- sitting outside on October 1st in Phoenix is a gamble when it comes to the temperature...  I immediately got the feeling that we had unwittingly selected a restaurant full of delicious secrets only the locals know about- you know, one of those places the Food Network would check out. :) And yes, in my opinion, Wally's feels more like a restaurant than a pub, since we were seated immediately with menus and assigned a server wearing an actual apron.  After ordering pints of 4 Peaks Hefeweizen and Negra Modelo, we decided we weren't hungry enough for dinner and ordered the Spinach and Artichoke Dip and Prawn Cocktail. I enjoyed the spin-art dip- a more generous portion than most places are serving for appetizers these days, standard flavors, served hot with perfectly salted tortilla chips. The Prawn Cocktail was nothing to write home about- average-sized shrimp and the cocktail sauce was, IMHO, seriously lacking in "zest." Then again, I like a pretty kickin cocktail sauce, full of horseradish.  I held back on the "stars" since we didn't order meals, but Chad, our server, didn't bat an eye when we announced we weren't having dinner- just delivered the check quickly and politely.   I may up the "stars" when we go back- saw several menu items that looked enticing, including S'Macs- baked mac and cheese in several varieties, prime rib with goat cheese mashed potatoes and pan-seared halibut.   I'll be back... probably soon. Got another hair appointment, soon... :)

e_iO9GtCfAM35G7mN2KXKg.text: My wife over heard someone at the gym today about this place and she literally dragged me there.  I was totally blown away with the service, food and environment.  'Baggers N Mash' was excellent, fresh mash potatoes with some lovely sausages in a tasty brown sauce of onions and mushrooms. Wonderful.  Fish and Chips, just got a bite, but excellent with light breading and fresh fish, french fried white and sweet potato fries very tasty.  Dessert to die for, chocolate fudge cake.  The serving size was about a quarter of the entire cake, that my wife and I had a serving there and also a nice snack with our afternoon tea.  Strongly recommend.  Found the price no more expensive than any other for a good meal, the serving size is in line with price.  Will return, this time she won't have to drag me for sure.  A very lovely place.

DblaaUkr-Ess7jcUaKm5uw.text: Great happy hour. Best pasta 'n' cheese I've had in some time is their Gruyere 'n' slab bacon. For a treat, ask for it over fries or mashed potatoes (instead of pasta). To quote Jon Stewart, "Faaaaaaa-bulouuuuuus!"  Also, very clean bathroom is a nice touch.

n-XZrDK8DCr19OrlCq8tcg.text: Great service, nice menu, but don't order the pannini' s,  they  are just a sandwich.

OJ1Yp4SerY-YVIWRbIRZ3w.text: I've lived close to Wally's for a few years and have never been there until tonight. Shaun was the most amazing waiter and we, we'll I, couldn't decide. He told me to pick three and he would surprise me. My man ordered Bourbon Street Pasta, which was fantastic and I was pleasantly surprised with Chicken Vesuvius out of the the three, I could not decide on.  Excellent food, excellent service! Great place!

YpQ6LaAak1efmjJ1Z2VAjg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. It is not pretentious but rather a great place to grab a bite with people who are glad to see you. Friendly staff, sometimes Wally will actually greet you and get your drinks. Great menu with salads and typical pub style fare but also awesome salads. Always recommend you ask about the special of the day. There are some great ones.   I have not been for happy hour, but I will admit, the beer on tap and whiskey selection appear to be enough to satisfy any happy hour need.   By the way, Tuesday is Ta-tor Tot Tuesday & the sweat potato fries can make it a toss up. So check it out...you will be back.

wZ0rbMfhK1Sxke7kKXQBEg.text: My husband and I were heading for the Cork & Cleaver for lunch when it was discovered they were closed due to a fire. Lucky for us we ended up at Wally's and what a find this place is. The employee's are terrific and they really seem to enjoy their jobs. From the moment we walked in we felt like our patronage was wanted. Very comfortable and the greatest part, the food was outstanding. We will be back and will bring our friends with us. Thanks Wally's for a great lunch

hIQBy8RU28-6PsbnNlvS5w.text: Well what can I say.  Great atmosphere.  Good Pub style food.  Cold drinks and a cantankerous owner!  My wife and I have been coming here for years and they always do a great job.    Food is consistently excellent with good portions and the fries are always perfect.  Wally's son Matt has been hosting the place more lately, so be sure to ask him why he's so much less cantankerous than his old man?  It's nice to see a family business do well as they all work hard every time you walk in the door to make sure you're welcome and that you're happy with everything.  Cheers

WgazZAeRNhKXsmlicnrtEw.text: I have been twice for happy hour. All their burgers are $7 during this time. I had one of the best veggie burgers I have ever had and definitely the best in the valley. My next visit I had the escargot with bleu cheese and it was delicious! I only wish the bread it was served with had been toasted otherwise it was perfect. I can't wait to visit the Gainey Village location.

7-wKlHCm6Q5j5FahunRD2w.text: Wally's has a fun Cheer's like atmosphere. It's dog friendly and allows you to bring your dog on the patio. I recently ate on the patio with a friend and our three dogs. They catered to us and our dogs were very chill. It was a wonderful experience! The Wally's at Gainey ranch has a Dog Days Sundays event every Sunday.

-xzhfDHpfm98iLl3ZK4A2A.text: Okay, THIS place is the bomb-diggity!!! They are pretty reasonably priced for the amount of food they give you and oh... the food! Super delicious!! I've had a few different things there now and I'm NEVER let down!! Their French Onion soup is delicious and the cobb salad was outstanding! My ex always get their 4 cheese macaroni and LOVES it!!! You can NEVER go wrong with Wally's!!!!! :-)

8KtryVklfXdOOVmNbKoTCg.text: Food is great and the service is spot on. I would highly recommend this place.

Q15dgPRzaSdP7qql36susw.text: I love the Vegetarian Burger they make here! So delicious! A really good menu and a very nice atmosphere! I recommend it!

urck99-UpDBaQmCWpaEUqA.text: Tried this place based on a recommendation and I was happy I did.  Wally seated us and he was really friendly along with all of the other staff.  They have great happy hour deals including delicious burgers!  Their mac n cheese was also really good.  We will definitely be repeat customers.

na91VxRlWBKimCKjuVewBg.text: service is always fantastic.  food is consistently amazing.  i have enjoyed this place for years.  I highly recommend any burger they make, and also every soup they have, especially the chili, which typically has prime rib in it.

ewxEdqx8cDz7zuEP8R6IEQ.text: We are definitely fans of this place!  The veggie burger and wine burger are excellent. Loved the atmosphere. Very unpretentious as another reviewer posted.

fW6UCFWwSrwmb8Go5xG0YQ.text: As in the name, a pub type atmosphere.  Food was way overpriced for pub food. $10 for a wedge salad and $12 for a burger.  Service was mediocre, waitress seemed more interested in helping out some friends than customers.

vOUM3tYSaDif_DrFXM2IqQ.text: Great place.  Food is very good, inside is nice, good service, and overall a cool place.  This place caters to a slightly older demographic (say 40-60), but we still love this neighborhood pub.  Can't go wrong with the cob salad.  Try the pinapple infused vodka.

CRjJs-2wpDnMHjmWdX6iMA.text: On a recent trip to Scottsdale we randomly found this place and decided to go inside and boy were we impressed.  The ribs were perfect and amazing as was the fish and chips.  Our waiter Jeremy was a pleasure he made us laugh and feel welcome.  Wouldn't mind if he sat down and ate with us he was great!  Loved this place!

Wx155c8cUGABh-UKPWx9lw.text: What a brilliant place!!! Food great, service even better and the atmosphere , well you just have to go there yourself and experience the place.   Awesome everyone!!! I'll be back tomorrow night!!!

9ahg8oy3xsual-Hp5uDZQQ.text: One of my favorite places to dine in the valley - everything is YUMMY /prices are reasonable / nice variety of items on happy hour menu/ outside dining/ great service

pxnMBslB8is9B-AfQYl9jg.text: Always have great service at Wally's and really enjoy the options they have on their menu.  It is usually fairly busy but never had to wait long. They have daily specials and I have often seen the owner, Wally, hanging out too. It is a great local spot.

M14BYZU6hnAGrwG6RqBNRg.text: Awesome food and service. Don't pass this place up if your in the area. You will regret it.

6SekK5TLhOa90LkfXz4Eqw.text: Except for one incident, this was a good experience and a great burger. Went for a Saturday happy Hour (3-6pm) which in itself is a good thing to have a daily HH. All burgers are $7.50 and normally the Bacon, Cheddar burger I received was $12, so it was a great deal. The fries were not as good as hyped, but it was a great burger and cooked perfectly well done. Well worth that price, maybe even $12 if you were in a burger craving mood. Now, my issue was not related to my food, but there was a  waiter who was grabbing straws from the dispenser by the top of the straw (where we drink from) and then putting it straight into unsuspecting folks drinks. I watched him do it three straight times and finally told him it was nasty and what the hell are you doing? He claimed that he normally does not grab the straws that style, but we all know he does and nobody pulls the wool over my eyes. Just a heads up. I would have mentioned it to the manager, but he was chewing gum like a cow while talking to customers, so the behavior must be trickling down from the top.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Straw area
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheddar bacon

Qb49C8H4QEDUY41fJAD2Kg.text: We stopped in for a drink after dinner at Flower Child tonight.  A friendly, local crowd was in this casual bar/restaurant.  We sat at the bar to watch preseason football and enjoy a beer.  The bartender was busy and not very engaging, but we weren't really looking to chat her up anyway.  Overall, a good experience!

XG2X-KuN122ixW2oqwhQtQ.text: It seems better since Jr took over. As of 2 weeks ago, no True manager.And servers seemed unprofessional. Worth another try. Just wondering why the owners would have 3 places within 6 blocks. Somewhat similar concepts.

4vg3CfCSZwPw1xbTHckYcQ.text: First time here at Wally's! I got a bacon cheddar burger and my dad got a Havana Cuban sandwich ! So good! I personally wasn't a fan of the sweet potato fries, but was very happy with the meal also loved the atmosphere. Although our waitress was visibly irritated with the kitchen timer. Kind of a downer. But great place!

BtVl1cutLrtw5xdLUju4eA.text: The food was amazing. Mac and cheese with andouille sausage to die for, portion enough to share if you get appetizers. Service incredible, owner is an Ernest Hemingway look alike and I am a fan. I was star struck.

HrQzKBZb5pVc1ELpGx4XLQ.text: Darn good!  I got the bacon s'mac with gorgonzola and WOW.  Be warned, its a big ol' serving!  This could easily be split between three people.  The gorgonzola is so rich and the huge servings of bacon is just insane by any carnivores standards.  Next time we visit Scottsdale we will be back!

n5qWdHa9QfGDnONHRJX41Q.text: Happened to be in the neighborhood and this location fit the bill for lunch recently.  They have a nice (dog friendly too) patio with plenty of shade and greenery.  I like patio dining and this worked well.   Unfortunately our lunch was only fair.  I had a caprese salad - mozzarella was perfect as were the greens & balsamic dressing but the heriloom tomato was rock hard.  Nice idea but try to eat green tomato as one of the main features of a salad, not so good.  Shouldn't they atleast try to serve a partially ripened tomato?  I mean someone had to hack through this rock to put it on the plate.  Burger was good, nothing spectacular - accompanied by a side salad loaded with onions and some funky version of their bleu cheese dressing (lots of pepper).    Our waiter was so-so.  One of those guys that doesn't write anything down and doesn't remember anything you specially requested.  And forget about returning to the table to see how everything is after food was delivered.  We had to track HIM down.    Maybe this was an off day or perhaps I  ust ordered the wrong thing.  I might go back if I were in the area again - if only for the patio experience and I'm not particularly hungry.

l6j2jCnXhNXJWa1PKUKXjA.text: I have been to this place for drinks and possibly food over a year ago. It was time to stop by for a casual dinner. I was eating light this night so ordered a salad which said : field greens, apple, berry, fresh mozzarella, and I added chicken. This dish was an embarrassment to salads. Hardly any greens, maybe half a chix breast, and mozzarella u could barely notice.   Husband had chix parm: nice size dish he liked it.   This is a cool place to have a drink but the food NO WAY. It is not memorable and there are too many other food places close by.

fwRQoq-RDesHmZYebSRWcA.text: I've heard from several people that Wally's is like a Phoenix landmark... it's been around for awhile and they supposedly have a great happy hour!  Crazy that in my 3 years in Phoenix, today was my first visit to Wally's, but it won't be my last!  I met 2 friends for lunch.  When we made our plans, they both suggested Wally's because of their convenient location and their 'caramelized vidalia onion & Guinness soup.'  I'm not a fan of french onion soup, but I really wanted to try Wally's anyways, so that's what we did!  I was acknowledged upon walking in by Chip, the General Manager... he was extremely friendly and suggested we sit outside since It was a beautiful day.  He was right - sitting on the patio was perfect!  Service was attentive and cold drinks were brought out right away... we started with the hot artichoke and spinach dip for the table... yum!  Good thing I worked out this morning, because I didn't feel quite as guilty enjoying this delicious appetizer - it was really tasty, and a generous portion too!  Of course, my friends Rachel and Lesley ordered the soup as planned - they both seemed to enjoy it.  I went with the Cobb salad.  It was your standard Cobb - with chicken, romaine and iceberg, diced tomato, egg, bleu cheese crumbles, avocado slices, chopped bacon, and balsamic dressing which I requested on the side.  It was good, but I think I was full from the chips and artichoke/spinach dip appetizer, so I couldn't finish it all.  Too full for dessert as well...  I'll have to return to Wally's for sure though - they had a pretty impressive bar menu with a ton of liquor, beer, and martinis too!  I noticed they had a kids menu, and some of my favorite desserts as well (hot apple pie and carrot cake).    Wally's happy hour is from 4-6p M-F with $1 off cocktails & beer and $2 off all appetizers... I'll be back for more of that artichoke and spinach dip with a beer or 2 next time for sure!  See you there!

nAoltpfhgANur-4HfTxRFw.text: What a great neighborhood restaurant! The atmosphere is cozy and friendly, the food is tasty and the prices are reasonable. What more can you ask for? We came here for dinner and sat at the bar but will definitely take advantage of their spacious outdoor patio next time. I ordered the veggie burger with a honey glaze coat which was amazing! My husband got the French dip and I stole a delicious bite. I want to order that next time. The sides were the best because they provide a mix of regular fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings! Perfection!

8cScQ_5sGUt_0FuSt1eEUw.text: Great place. Feels like home cooked meals. Meat loaf is my favorite dish but I have a feeling everything is pretty darn good.

EX9uBT1BKB-aNvhQPAvy3w.text: Great environment,i got the wallu burger and mixed fries.super bomb.our waitress beth was on point with everything will be coming back fosure

lCftkS_3V_YTKWpZ-KpNhw.text: Great place for some good old-fashioned 'murican grub! I came with the infamous Tom, who is well known in the pub, and that told me right off the bat this is an awesome place to come!  We had a great waitress who was quick and friendly! I had the Home-Made Veggie Burger, and would recommend it, if you are into that kind of stuff. It was incredibly juicy, sticky and impossible to really eat like a regular burger. But, alas, I guess that is what you get! The flavor was spot on, just had to use the fork to get to it. I also really enjoyed the mixed fries! I had never had sweet potato fries, but I'm willing to try them again! Also, the mac 'n cheese plate looks amazing. Killer and heart-burning, but delicious. Kinda pricey, I thought, but I haven't been around the area too long yet.

MQU3XvVowGAoWZhqEa9_GQ.text: What a great deal for happy hour.  The food was excellent, the services was 4 star.and the prices were right where they should be. The rueben was the best REUBEN my wife has everr had,,,, so lean and tasty.

qfZpNuGg-FRXL6D6UzcoSA.text: Great spot to stop in for a last-minute decision on dinner.  Happened to be a Sunday night and they had half off wine by the bottle (score!) As I was in a pickle-y mood, I decided to get the Cuban sandwich.  This is maybe my favorite Cuban to date!  There were SPEARS of pickles, chipotle mayo, roasted pork loin, thick sliced ham and a grain mustard piled high on a ciabatta-type bread. It was reaaallll good. Came with mixed fries (half sweet potato) which was just what I wanted... I only ate half and the other half was my lunch today (still delicious when cold.) Wally's has 'Blue Plate Specials' that change every day. One of our party got the Iron Skillet Chicken which he ate all of... The special comes with dessert, white chocolate bread pudding, which I got to nibble on since he doesn't like raisins (double score!)  Overall, the food is really good and very fair priced. The wine was also priced really well and a bonus at half off.  Our server was prompt, made great recommendations and never let our glasses go empty.  I hope to get back here soon!!

rMmbWgRhUxqo7FkbVQhbZw.text: I had lunch at Wally's on a day when I wanted to eat healthier--- let's just say, that day was shot I had to call for a do-over the next day.  But oh, my Wally Burger was good!   Very laid back and easy going, I will return.  It's been awhile, but I will return.   We sat on the patio and I really enjoyed the casual-ness.  It's hidden, so you  have to go look for it.  44th/Camelback on the NE corner shopping center.   See you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From the wallys website
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qzAMBzqG5I1IgnQsq9Jbiw.text: Swung by on a Wednesday to take advantage of their solid happy hour specials.  They have a great selection of $4 draft beers and $8 burgers (typically $11-$12) which is a great value compared to all of the other places in this area.  You don't even have to look too hard to find Wally which is cool considering the LGO and Fox takeover that is going on in the area (yikes!).    Grassroots Kitchen is also pretty legit and I believe Wally's son runs it.  It's near 20th Street and Camelback and worth checking out as well.

G7vzfY7zyPAKCFmMxWdYBA.text: While visiting Phoenix we happened upon this place and were pleasantly surprised at how good the burgers tasted!    It was a nice evening so we sat outside (coming from the snow we had this winter, sitting outside was something I didn't think would ever happen again).    The menu was pretty extensive, I think anyone in your party should be able to find something to please them.  Usually I would expect with such a large menu the food would be just okay.  But not this place, at least not as far as the burgers.  I ordered the buttons and bleu burger and my boyfriend ordered bacon cheddar burger.  We both ordered our burgers medium rare and they were cooked perfectly!  There was a ton of mushrooms and bleu cheese on mine and lots of bacon and cheddar on his.  So much so, that he was able to share some bacon with me.    The burgers came with a mixture of regular fries and sweet potato fries (my favorite).  I loved the idea of mixing them so you don't have to decide on one or the other.    Overall, the food was delicious, the prices were fair (especially for amount of food) and outside sitting was perfect!  If ever in Phoenix again, I will definitely go back to this place.

doyjvT_W9MKadAPKNPVaZA.text: One of my favorite haunts.   They know you by name and what you like!   Great patio!  Great food!  Great staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet mignon medallions Trio. Delicious!!!!
Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i6s0Zgs2enjPHRnVN3R9Og.text: Love Wally's - just an outstanding neighborhood bar and grill. Myself and my friends visit Wally's often and we are huge fans. The restaurant is always clean and inviting, the food is consistently excellent, and the service is terrific. Also, if you're a draft beer fan, they have a great selection.   I highly recommend the chop salad with cold chicken!!

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I2rWvraD0O3PiU_wmcP7bQ.text: One time I did dine at Wally's A s'mac it was great with much cheese I look left I look right It's been a great night Their staff is chalk full of hotties.

S4N6Rv9kfDLmOCAgMDXVDQ.text: I've been going to Wally's for a long time and spent quite a bit of money there.  It;s been OK for most part for several years.  But, I've got to tell you that it seems they really want to get you in and out as quickly as possible.  Even if they are not full, with plenty of tables open.  They do want to rush you.  trying to take your order for food when they have not even brought out the drinks you've ordered.  They need to keep their customer in mind and they are not doing do this.  At least not any more.

-NXaHmb1IiHtnee33XLWrw.text: Great salad dressing, wonderful escargot appetizer with blue cheese, scrumptious Prime Rb, with marvelous mashed potatoes and great gelato. You can't beat this place for food, value, service, and ambiance.

IujRdXbxdMpioCDrBMy2jw.text: Cheeseburger S'mac is THE BOMB. Granted, it's the only thing I've tried there so far but I am going to be back for more!

V3L-zMH_phCDdfCj9R7yqw.text: Our go-to place for date night. Upon entering you're greeted immediately by the friendly and courteous staff.  You'll find that there's something on the menu for everyone. My personal favorite is the classic Cobb Salad. The ingredients are always fresh, and always consistent! A huge plus in my book :) Delicious comfort food, tasty drinks, and a great location. You can't go wrong with Wally's.

61Dum2AbbT0syuJYhPddjA.text: Got the gyuere and slab bacon s'mac. It was AMAZBALLS. There are about a dozen other things I want to try but so far so good. I can't wait to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Wally's American Pub N Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyuere and slab bacon s&#39;mac

el-q6ISDNQ5WmmzK0wW-MQ.text: My family and I are die-hard fans.  A trip to Phoenix is not complete unless we can eat dinner at Wally's at least once.  I highly recommend the pot roast, which is so tender.  Also, the iced tea is phenomenal.

y1C2bZL9xUF0DSQCCDOmtg.text: Such a great neighborhood spot. I would have probably never tried this place had it not been for the recommendation of others but I'm so glad we did. It was pretty busy when we went and the entrance was very crowded and uncomfortable to wait in but once we got to our table everything got better. Service was perfect and everyone who works there from the hostess to the bussers were very warm and friendly. Started with the spinach artichoke dip- sooo good. I ordered the chicken picatta hesitantly because I never order chicken out (so easy to make at home) but holy cow definitely a chicken dish I will return for. The sauce was so scrumptious and the horseradish mashed potatoes went nicely as well. Only complaint is that the vegetables seemed previously frozen. Finished with the bread pudding which we gobbled up in seconds. We spent more money than we thought we would at a casual neighborhood spot but quality was consistent in everything we ordered and overall was worth it. Looking forward to returning.

-uJTKelGxs1YfMxiSps9oA.text: Good food and great ambience. The food was great. Burgers, salads, and shrimp cocktail were great. My only complaint is that the service was a little slower than I would have liked  at a time when it wasn't very busy. Would definitely give it another try!

qB5ZvwNmbdDAcf2vepl7Pg.text: OK - love this place. It is great. Family owned and operated. Wally is a star and his staff are fantastic. Cannot say enough about this place. Great place for family meals and a overall great time.   My kids love the Mack and Cheese. A pure favorite. Suggest that you try it out. Great food, great service and a team that is there to please. Arizona needs more of these establishments. Stay away from the chasins - make these local places florish!

Kg06QsISjEXGrR6ChhqfLg.text: A family friendly place with consistently good food and service!  Excellent happy hour, excellent menu... it is one of my favorite places to meet folks for dinner!

_OCEUC25LIG3Rge77G_r-w.text: We have driven past this place a million times and hadn't thought to go in until one day we just took the plunge. Its in a great spot and they even have room for a cute little patio. Although I wanted to be bad and get every fried item on the menu, hubby and I opted for some yummy salads. I had the cobb and he had the asian salad. Both were fresh and delicious and we would get them again but next time I go, I want to try some of the other items. We saw food come out and it looked great! Its definitely a nice lunch spot and I am sure dinner is great too, but you can also see it being a great place to belly up and hang out.

cqyDSApcNXz8781yH1EZNA.text: Are you bored with being treated nicely and with respect by restaurant proprietors? Tired of being treated decently by the folks to whom you are about to give money?  If so, then Wally's is the place for you. Insults and rudeness are the daily special. On our visit, we had trouble finding it because of the glare of the setting sun. I called and immediately apologized for having to ask for directions but could he help. "You're challenged," the guy running the place declared. But he did us one better! When I went in to ask if that was normal treatment for customers, he said I couldn't take a joke, said "goodbye" and made a wisecrack about knowing where they are. The motto must be: "The customer is always worth insulting."

UukhO06gWXbp9RCdXhdKSg.text: Had dinner at Wally's based upon a recommendation of a friend, and it is definitely a place to add to your favorites while in Phoenix.  A family run establishment which has great food and drink selections.  A real Pub, with a casual atmosphere and it's not sports bar-ish.    Ask for the daily specials.  The ribs are great but get there before they run out.

ryTKVcDlua1gdfDRPsz1uA.text: We finally made our way over here for dinner. We sat outside in their patio area which is cozy, and dog friendly! I had their French Dip and I must admit, it was the best I have ever had. The roll is so soft, and they serve it with a side of horseradish aioli. Yum! Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dinner. And the service is fabulous, everyone was so pleasant.  Can't wait to go back!

2kOLlSS7HrjWrBXqicwEFQ.text: This is one of our favorite neighborhood "go-to" restaurants.  I am surprised by some of the reviews of poor service....we have always been impressed by the service.  We are always greeted with a smile by Wally or his son.  We often have our young kids in tow, and have always felt they are just as welcome, even with Wally's being an "upscale" pub.  I especially enjoy sitting on their patio... it is one of the best in the area.    As for the food.... We've tried most of the items on the menu, and haven't been disappointed yet.  Even the kids' mac'n'cheese is to die for!!  My favorite is the chinese chicken salad.  Good variety on the menu with consistent quality of food.
